themes: peer-led workshops and trainings for collective action
continuation of transitional support for creative spaces
impact of affordability crisis on artists and venues
potential for universal basic income for artists
recognition of non-economic value of art
key_phrases: contract local experts to offer workshops or trainings for peers
foster more collective action and collaboration across the arts community
share the wealth of knowledge local arts folks have
Creative Space Assistance Program (still active?) has served an essential stopgap
help artistic venues survive amidst the city's affordability crisis
CSAP, or something like it, should continue to be implemented as a transitional measure
experiment with a UBI / basic income pilot program for artists
create the conditions for artists in which they have the time and space required to make deeply impactful art
cost of living . housing didn't require people to work multiple jobs to survive, or move out of the city limits, as now
recognizing the powerful *non-economic* value of art as a public good
barriers_identified: affordability crisis wrought by unfettered growth-hyperfocused economic development
cost of living and housing requiring people to work multiple jobs or move out of the city limits
lack of recognition of the non-economic value of art
solutions_proposed: city to contract local experts to offer workshops or trainings for peers
continue or replicate the Creative Space Assistance Program as a transitional measure
experiment with a UBI / basic income pilot program for artists
public support for artists recognizing the non-economic value of art
